key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.AssumeOverflowX
key.description:
Indicates if the reporting engine should truncate the data to make it fit in the defined area (true) or if the engine will expect the viewer to truncate the data to the appropriate size (false) when generating XLS output.
The default value is TRUE.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.CellWidthScaleFactor
key.description:
The scale factor for the cell width (a double value). The cell width of spreadsheet files depends on the font size of the font used to render the contents on the client system. As we can't know that size, we have to guess, and as with every guessing, this may or may not be correct.
Experience showed, that a scale factor of 50 is a good estamination to match the built-in default of 'Arial 10' used by Excel and POI.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.EnhancedDataFormat
key.description: Whether to apply the Cell-DataFormat strings to excel cells. If disabled, all content is inserted as text. This way you won't be able to perform calculations on the generated content, but it is more safe in case of invalid cell formats.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.GridLinesDisplayed
key.description: Defines, whether sheets generated by the excel export should display grid-lines in the viewer.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.GridLinesPrinted
key.description: Defines, whether sheets generated by the excel export should print grid-lines.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.HardStyleCountLimit
key.description: Limits the number of defined styles to 4000. Excel seems to crash if there are too many styles defined in a workbook. Once the limit is reached, and this property is set to true (which is the default), all subsequent style definitions will be ignored for that workbook.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.Module
key.description: A module definition. Please do not edit this entry.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.Paper
key.description: Defines the Paper that should be used in the excel print setup. If no paper is defined, an suitable paper will be selected automaticly.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.PaperOrientation
key.description: Defines the Paper that should be used in the excel print setup. If no paper is defined, an suitable paper will be selected automaticly. Valid values are "Landscape" or "Portrait"

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.DeviceResolution
key.description: Adjusts the resultion of the images embedded in the XLS files. By default we use 96 DPI, which is the common default for Windows systems.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.ShapeAsContent
key.description: Defines, whether Shape-content that is not one of the recognized background shapes will be printed as image. If set to false, the content will be removed, if set to true, the content ends up as image.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.StrictLayout
key.description: Defines whether a stricter, but more accurate layout algorithm should be applied. Setting this property to false will greatly reduce the table complexity and increases the chances that the generated Excel-Sheets are editable by humans and can be used for further computations.

key.name: org.pentaho.reporting.engine.classic.core.modules.output.table.xls.TreatEllipseAsRectangle
key.description: Defines whether ellipse shapes are treated as rectangles or as image content. If set to true, ellipses are rectangles and will be translated into cell-backgrounds, false they will be exported as images.
